newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss shares end with marked slump.
newsitem.headline: Swiss shares end with marked slump.

text.p: Swiss shares ended with a marked slump but above the day's lows on Wednesday after easing futures on the blue-chip Swiss Market Index (SMI) and early losses on Wall Street added pressure in the second half of the session.
"The situation is disappointing," a dealer said, noting that the bourse has been consolidating for almost two weeks. Volumes were described as moderate.
One trader said the SMI should find support at 3,740/50 points, adding the current low level may lead to renewed interest.
The SMI fell 0.86 percent, or 32.4 points, to 3,742.9. The all-share SPI shed 0.79 percent, or 19.09 points, to 2,403.43.
SMI index November futures slid 38.5 points to 3,740.0, hitting shares with a heavy weighting in the index.
Roche certificates slumped 110 francs to 9,540 francs. Ciba and Sandoz lost around one percent.
Among financials, CS Holding were flat at 127 francs while insurer Baloise added five francs to 2,615. UBS bearer shares were down 13 francs to 1,226.
Among industrials, ABB and Alusuisse shed 0.3 percent each, and Nestle gave up nine francs to 1,388.
Swissair and Electrowatt were among the day's winners. Swissair rebounded from recent lows, jumping nearly three percent to 999. Electrowatt ended up one franc at 481.
Shares of watchmaker TAG Heuer dropped 3.9 percent to 209.00 francs.
